title: Rotnl kinematics - cylinder on accelerating disk

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. A motor (not shown) can spin the disk about its center. Both objects are initially at rest when the motor is turned on at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. The cylinder does not slide relative to the surface of the disk as the disk rotates. For the following questions, express all algebraic answers in terms of <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, <math alttext="omega sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate. (a)i. Derive an expression for the maximum net torque exerted on the cylinder-disk system about the disk’s center.
